ch.ecma.csta.errors

Class CstaException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • ch.ecma.csta.errors.CstaException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CSTAPrivateDataInfoErrorException, OperationException, PerformanceManagementException, PrivateErrorException, SecurityException, StateIncompatibilityException, SubscribedResourceAvailabilityException, SystemResourceAvailabilityException

    public class CstaException
extends java.lang.Exception
    Signals that a CSTA error has occurred. CSTA provides diagnostic error information in the negative acknowledgement to service requests. The diagnositc error information consists of an error category and a category specific error value. CstaException is the parent for all exceptions produced by failed CSTA requests. There is a sub-exception for each category of CSTA error. For example, the category of OperationErrors is represented by an OperationException. Applications can either retrieve the specific CSTAErrorCode associated with this exception by using the getCSTAErrorCode method and/or they can catch specific exceptions.
    Author:
    Avaya Inc.
    See Also:
    "ECMA-269, sections 9.3 Diagnostic Error Definitions and 12.2.14 ErrorValue", Serialized Form

      Constructs a new exception with the specified detail message.

      Constructs a new exception with the specified detail message and cause.
      CstaException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
      Constructs a new exception with the specified cause and a detail message.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CstaException

        public CstaException()
        Constructs a new exception with null as its detail message. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to Throwable.initCause(java.lang.Throwable).

      • CstaException

        public CstaException(java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a new exception with the specified detail message. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to Throwable.initCause(java.lang.Throwable).
        Parameters:
        message - the detail message. The detail message is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getMessage() method.

      • CstaException

        public CstaException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs a new exception with the specified cause and a detail message. The detail message typically contains the class and the cause in string form. If the specified cause is null, then the cause string in the detail message is also null. This constructor is useful for exceptions that are little more than wrappers for other throwables.
        Parameters:
        cause - the cause (which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getCause() method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)

      • CstaException

        public CstaException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs a new exception with the specified detail message and cause.

        Note that the detail message associated with cause is not automatically incorporated in this exception's detail message.

        Parameters:
        message - the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getMessage() method).
        cause - the cause (which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getCause() method). A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorValue

        public ErrorValue getErrorValue()
        Deprecated. Use getCSTAErrorCode instead
        Retrieves a copy of the CSTAErrorCode associated with this exception. Since both ErrorValue and CSTAErrorCode extend from UniversalFailuer, it copies the common data
        Returns:
        a copy of the CSTAErrorCode

      • getCSTAErrorCode

        public CSTAErrorCode getCSTAErrorCode()
        Returns the CSTAErrorCode (negative acknowledgement) associated with the exception
        Returns:
        The CSTAErrorCode associated with the exception
